intro: Erysimum hieraciifolium var. densisiliquum, commonly known as the dense silique erysimum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a slender, elongated silique containing several seeds. This variety is distinguished by its dense arrangement of silique fruits along the flowering stems.
